intro: Sida xavieri, commonly known as Xavier's sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, triangular stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and are often covered in fine hairs. Sida xavieri is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
